title: Two Species of Mussel Predators Graph

content.prompt: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by the data in the graph?

choices.label: Pisaster is an indicator species, because when it was removed the proportion of live mussels was less than when Pisaster were present.
Pisaster is a keystone species, because when Nucella was removed the proportion of live mussels was similar to the control.
Nucella is an indicator species, because when it was removed the proportion of live mussels was greater than when Nucella was present.
Nucella is a keystone species, because when Pisaster was removed the proportion of live mussels was similar to the control.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
